Skills

Proficiencies

Mutation - Powerhouse

Mutation Level
The Infection has caused your character to mutate, bringing you to a new evolutionary path. Although you retain some sense of humanity, you are no longer a Homo Sapien but...something else.

The mutation has increased your physical strength and speed greatly. Your character's attribute limit on Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, Perception, or Athletics is now capped at 10. You are immune to most mental traumas.

However, increasing any other skill, proficiency, or attribute (other than the ones mentioned previously) requires 3x the EXP cost. The only exceptions for this is the Melee-Unarmed proficiency.

Level 1 - Your Unarmed Melee attacks are empowered and you may add your Strength modifier to each Unarmed Melee damage rolls.
Level 2 - ???
Level 3 - ???

Abilities

Ability Lvl
Select an ability to see its description.
Gain more actions in combat.
Level 1 - No energy penalty when repeating an action.
Level 2 - Gain a third action by spending 2 energy.
Level 3 - Third action no longer costs 2 energy.
Gain the Analyze ability - Learn the exact challenge to beat for any action or the exact health/armor of a target.
Level 1 - Can use Analyze 3 times a play session.
Level 2 - Analyze can be used 5 times a play session. Determining the health of enemy targets no longer count towards this limit.
Level 3 - Using analyze on your own character actions no longer counts toward the play session limit.
Gain Cleave : when hitting an enemy with a melee attack, it can hit one enemy adjacent to your target that is within your range.
Level 1 - Cleave deals half damage to the secondary target.
Level 2 - Cleave can now hit an additional enemy.
Level 3 - Cleave deals full damage to secondary targets.
Your character can spend resources to improve the rolls of other characters.
Level 1 - Go Team!: Prior to another player making a roll, you can spend 1 resource (matching the resource type they spend) to improve their total roll by 1d6.
Level 2 - If You Can't Do It!: You can now spend as much resources as you like to improve a roll.
Level 3 - Nobody Can!: You can now retroactively improve rolls after a player rolls it. This costs 2 resources to do so.
Your character gains the Knowledge ability. Knowledge allows you to attempt any untrained skill at a skill level equal to your Intelligence roll if you pass an active Intelligence check first.
Level 1 - Can use Knowledge twice a play session.
Level 2 - Knowledge no longer has a play session limit.
Level 3 - The Intelligence check is not a passive check and doesn't require resources.
Gain the Mulligan ability - Re-roll any roll. Limited uses per play session.
Level 1 - Can use Mulligan once a play session.
Level 2 - Can use Mulligan twice a play session.
Level 3 - Can use Mulligan three times a play session
Your character gains reaction attacks to enemy melee attacks.
Level 1 - Fast as Lightening: Successful dodging or grab-breaking gives you a single dice melee attack reaction.
Level 2 - A Little Bit Frightening: Successful dodging or grab-breaking gives you a full melee attack reaction.
Level 3 - Kungfu Fighting: Making a successful melee attack automatically grants a free dodge action (once per turn).
Your character gains bonuses when attacking while stealthed. Attacking immediately breaks stealth.
Level 1 - Gain an additional free attack roll when attacking from stealth.
Level 2 - Gain an additional 1d6 damage roll per successful attack when attacking from stealth.
Level 3 - Gain additional +2 to each attack and damage roll when attacking from stealth.
You can spend actions to empower a ranged attack.
Level 1 - Snipe: Spend your entire turn to make an empowered ranged attack. Snipe adds 2 free attack rolls at no cost.
Level 2 - Snipe now adds your dexterity modifier to each damage roll.
Level 3 - Snipe now only costs one action. However, you cannot make any other attacks if you used Snipe in the same turn.
Gain the Counseling ability, which restores sanity to other players. Any character can only receive counseling at most once a day
Level 1 - Counseling restores 1d4 + charisma modifier. This can be used twice a day.
Level 2 - Counseling restores 1d6 + charisma modifier. Gain one additional use per day.
Level 3 - Counseling now restores 1d10 + charisma and restores a minimum of 4 sanity.

Flaws

Select a flaw to see its description
If your character moves more than 5 spaces in a turn, you must pass a Constitution check or else take 1d10 damage.
If you roll an initiative of 8 or lower, your first action will be a Stress Response.
Whenever you roll and 1/2 or more of the rolls are critical fails, there is a chance the outcome becomes a catastrophic failure, leading to a butterfly effect chain that ends in a disaster. This can occur no more than once a play session.
Your character occasionally slips. Your character must pass a Dexterity or Athletics active roll or else causes an accident.
Your character only restores 2 energy per unit of food.
Health regain effects are reduced by 50%.
If your character takes damage, roll a D20. If the roll is 10 or under, your character's glasses break, giving you a -5 penalty to ranged attacks and Perception.
Your character does not get a Long Rest bonus for resource restoration.
Your character has a rare, incurable disease. Your character now has a daily consumption requirement of 1 special medicine. If starting the game with this flaw, start with 3 special medicine.
Two times a play session, the ZM can force you to re-roll any roll. Any resources spent on the initial roll are refunded.
